sn9.9:4.1: At one time a certain Vajjian mendicant was staying near Vesālī in a certain forest grove.
sn9.9:4.2: Now at that time the Vajjians were holding an all-night event in Vesālī.
sn9.9:4.3: Then that mendicant, groaning at the clamor of musical instruments being beaten and played, on that occasion recited this verse:
sn9.9:5.2: like a cast-off log in the forest.
sn9.9:6.1: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them. So they approached that mendicant wanting to stir them up,
sn9.9:7.2: like a cast-off log in the forest.
sn9.9:7.3: Lots of people are jealous of you,
sn9.9:7.4: like beings in hell of those going to heaven.”
sn9.9:8.1: Stirred up by that deity, that mendicant came to their senses.
